channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:

item.title: Honiton Road, both sides, between Victoria Road and Hartland Road, 26th August
item.description:
There are plenty of leaves on both pavements and roads. The pavement is slippery and dangerous when wet, the leaves on the street block the gutters. This needs to be swept and cleaned immediately please. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: . Parking illegal on a grass verge. Causing damage to viral service manhole covers, 26th August
item.description:
This issue have been reported previously. Cars are parking on a grass verge and damaging the manhole covers of a water valve and telephone manhole. We lost internet civet last year due to flooding in this area. A wooden post was placed unmistakable. Front of the verge to stop the parking it has been missing for over two years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Falloden Way, Temple Fortune, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 26th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackwall Lane, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Manhole cover banging, 26th August

item.title: 4 bags of rubbish, 26th August
item.description:

item.title: Daily! Rubbish pile since months, 26th August
item.description:
This spot on Cremer street cornering with Nazrul street has a large volume of rubbish since months. I have pictures from June, July and August, but the problem is going on far longer. Often it flows into the sidewalk and there is no space for walking.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low hanging sign on Dartford Road outside Crosby House, 26th August
item.description:
My family member has hit their forehead on the bottom part of this sign, causing bleeding and a bump. The person is 1.63m tall therefore the sign seems to be much lower than the regulation height for a pavement sign.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous pot holes in Norman Park car park, 26th August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Widmore, London

item.title: Tree on Timbercroft Lane, 26th August
item.description:
